Rulings.Base: 1. Removing the monster from play is a cost. It is treated as being temporarily removed from play.\n2. You don't have to return the monster to the same Monster Card Zone it was in originally.\n3. If the activation or effect of "Paradox Fusion" is negated, the removed monster will not return during your 2nd End Phase.

PSCT.Base: When a monster(s) would be Special Summoned, OR a Spell/Trap Card is activated: Banish 1 face-up Fusion Monster you control; negate the Special Summon or activation, and if you do, destroy that card, also during your 2nd End Phase, return the banished Fusion Monster to your field in face-up Attack Position.
